ITEM.name: Topological Journal: Writing a Validation Tool
Creating a Single Patch NURBS Surface
Creating a Multi Patch NURBS Surface
Modifying the Degree of a Nurbs
Line
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create body of a line (between two points, with a given direction,tangent or angled to a wire, infinite, normal to a shell).

ITEM.name: Spline
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Spline

ITEM.name: Spine
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Spine

ITEM.name: Conic
ITEM.text: how are modeled conic curves from geometrical point of view and how to create and to use them.

ITEM.name: Isoparametric Curve
ITEM.text: is an example of how to compute the isoparametric curve along u or v passing through a point on a surface.

ITEM.name: Geodesic
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a geodesic line on a surface.

ITEM.name: Helix
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a geometric helix by using the CATGeoFactory::CreateHelix API.

ITEM.name: Boundary
ITEM.text: is an example of how to retrieve the boundaries of a skin or of a wire by using the CATICGMHybBoundary operator.

ITEM.name: Corner
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a corner by using the CATICGMTopCorner operator.

ITEM.name: Create curve lissing a set of points
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a a smoothed nurbs curve lissing a set of points by using the CATICGMLiss operator.

ITEM.name: Deform curves on a set of points
ITEM.text: is an example of how to deform curves on a set of points by using the CATICGMInterproxCrv operator.

ITEM.name: Achieving a Given Geometric Continuity along a Wire
ITEM.text: is an example of how to correct or improve the (dis)continuities along a wire by using the CATICGMTopCleanCrvOperator operator.

ITEM.name: Connecting Wires with Reference Curve
ITEM.text: is an example of how to connect two wires by specifying a base curve by using the CATICGMTopSimilarCurve operator.

ITEM.name: Connecting Wires with Spline Curve
ITEM.text: is an example of how to connect wires between with a spline curve by using the CATICGMTopologicalBlendCurve operator.

ITEM.name: Splitting a Wire
ITEM.text: is an example of how to split a wire by another wire, a shell or a vertex by using the CATICGMHybSplit operator.

ITEM.name: Extrapolating a Wire
ITEM.text: is an example of how to extrapolate a wire in tangency by using the CATICGMWireExtrapolationOp operator.

ITEM.name: Creating a Non-Manifold Wire
ITEM.text: is an example of how create a non-manifold wire by assembling lines using the CATICGMHybAssemble operator.

ITEM.name: Reflect Lines
ITEM.text: is an example of how to generate reflect lines on a surface by using the CATICGMTopReflectLine operator.

ITEM.name: Blend
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a surface that connects two wires with a skin by using the CATICGMTopBlend operator.

ITEM.name: Prism
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Prism Surface by using the CATICGMTopPrism operator

ITEM.name: Revolution
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Revolution Surface by using the CATICGMTopRevolution operator

ITEM.name: Profile Sweep
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Sweep Surface by using the CATICGMTopSweep operator

ITEM.name: Circle Sweep: One Guide and Tangency Surface
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a circle sweep with one guide and a tangency surface by using the CATICGMTopSweepWireSkinCircle operator

ITEM.name: Circle Sweep: Three Guides
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a circle sweep with three guides by using the CATICGMFrFTopologicalSweep operator

ITEM.name: Circle Sweep: Two Guides and Radius Law
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a circle sweep with two guides and radius law by using the CATICGMFrFTopologicalSweep operator

ITEM.name: Circle Sweep: Two Guides and Tangency Surface
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a circle sweep with two guides and Tangency Surface by using the CATICGMFrFTopologicalSweep operator

ITEM.name: Sweep with Two Tangency Surfaces, Implicit Profile
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a sweep from a Spine and Two Tangency Surfaces by using the CATICGMTopSweepSkinSkinSegment operator

ITEM.name: Sweep: Using the Smoothing Options
ITEM.text: is an example of how to use the Smooth Sweeping option of the CATICGMFrFTopologicalSweep operator

ITEM.name: Fill
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a fill by using the CATICGMPowerFill operator

ITEM.name: Fillet: Untwist
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Fillet by using the CATICGMDynAdvancedFillet operator

ITEM.name: Extract a Face from a Solid
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a 2D body from a face belonging to a solid by using the CATICGMTopExtractFace operator

ITEM.name: Modify the Geometry of a Face
ITEM.text: is an example of how to replace the geometry of a face by a new surface by using the CATICGMTopFaceReplaceSurface operator

ITEM.name: Modifying the Face Orientations in a Shell
ITEM.text: is an example of how to modify the orientation of faces so that they all have the same orientation as the shell by using the CATICGMTopShellOrientation operator

ITEM.name: Remove Faces from a Body
ITEM.text: is an example of how to remove a set of faces from a body by using the CATICGMAdvancedRemoveFaceOpe operator

ITEM.name: Reflect Lines
ITEM.text: is an example of how to generate reflect lines on a surface by using the CATICGMTopReflectLine operator

ITEM.name: Silhouette
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create silhouette (two-dimensional representation of the shape of body as projected orthographically upon a planar screen) by using the CATICGMTopSilhouette operator

ITEM.name: Splitting a Shell
ITEM.text: is an example of how to split a shell by another shell or a wire by using the CATICGMHybSplit operator

ITEM.name: Intersecting Shells
ITEM.text: is an example of how to intersect two shells by using the CATICGMHybIntersect operator

ITEM.name: Triming a shell or a wire by a volume
ITEM.text: is an example of using the CATICGMTopRelimitByVolume operator.

ITEM.name: Retrieving the CATMathBox2D of An Edge or a Face
ITEM.text: is an example of how to compute the CATMathBox2D of an edge or a face by using the CATICGM2DBoxComputation operator

ITEM.name: Elementary Solid
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create and dump topology of a sphere, a torus, a pyramid, a cuboid and a cylinder solid

ITEM.name: Prism
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Prism Volume by using the CATICGMTopPrism operator

ITEM.name: Revolution
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Revolution Volume by using the CATICGMTopRevolution operator

ITEM.name: Sweep
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a Sweep Volume by using the CATICGMTopSweep operator

ITEM.name: Boolean Intersection
ITEM.text: is an example of how to perform a Boolean intersection between two solids

ITEM.name: Boolean Union
ITEM.text: is an example of how to perform a Boolean Union between two solids

ITEM.name: Chamfer
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a beveled surface between the two original faces common to an edge

ITEM.name: Basic Draft
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a basic draft by using the CATICGMDynDraft operator

ITEM.name: Draft: Untwist
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a draft with 'untwist' mode, by using the CATICGMDynAdvancedDraft operator

ITEM.name: Extract a Face from a Solid
ITEM.text: is an example of how to extract a face from a solid

ITEM.name: Fillet
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create constant fillets, variable fillets and fillets with rolling edges

ITEM.name: Modify the Geometry of a Face
ITEM.text: is an example of how to extrapolate the adjacent faces up to the replacing surface in order to build a new solid.

ITEM.name: Simplify the topology of a Body
ITEM.text: is an example of how to simplify a topological body in order to remove unnecessary faces and build a consistent body topology.

ITEM.name: Pattern
ITEM.text: is an example of how to create a pattern

ITEM.name: Computing the Area of a CATFace and the Length of a CATEdge
Computing the Extrema of a Body
